answer.a: Needle-like leaves
answer.b: Leaves

answer.a: Flowers are catkins. Leaves flat, mostly toothed
answer.b: Leaves other

answer.a: Male catkins cylindrical, with 2 anther-cells to each scale. Fruit a dry cone, with 2 winged seeds within each scale
answer.b: Other

answer.a: Male catkins small, with 4 anther-cells to each scale. Fruit small and succulent, containing 2 or 3 hard seeds
answer.b: Male catkins small, with 3 to 8 anther-cells to each of the upper scales. Fruit a single seed, half-immersed in a succulent cup

answer.a: Tree or shrub in fruit
answer.b: Tree or shrub in flower

answer.a: Nut capsules opening in 2 pieces, seeds minute with long cotton-like hairs
answer.b: Nuts 1-seeded

answer.a: Nuts small in compact catkins
answer.b: Nuts solitary, in clusters or in pendant-like spikes. Wholly or partially enclosed in an involucre

answer.a: Nuts slightly succulent, resinous outside
answer.b: Nuts flat and dry

answer.a: Scales of the catkins thin, detach easily. Nuts winged
answer.b: Scales of the catkins hard, remaining after the nuts have fallen

answer.a: Nuts (acorns) in a small cup-shaped cupule
answer.b: Other

answer.a: Nuts completely enclosed in a prickly involucre
answer.b: Other

answer.a: Nuts small, in a 3-lobed leafy involucre, arranged in a pendant-like spike
answer.b: Nuts solitary or clustered, each in a leafy, toothed involucre attaching at the base

answer.a: Scales of the male catkins broad and overlapping. Anthers longer than their filaments
answer.b: Scales of the male catkins narrow-linear, divided or very minute. Anthers small and slender filaments

answer.a: Male and female catkins short, sessile and upright
answer.b: Male catkins cylindrical, usually hanging down

answer.a: Three distinct flowers, each with 4 stamens, under each scale of the male catkin. Female catkins small and ovoid
answer.b: 6-12 within each scale, not in distinct flowers

answer.a: Scales of the male catkins stalked. Female catkins cylindrical
answer.b: Scales of the catkin sessile

answer.a: Stamens at the base of the scale. Female catkins loose, with narrow scales
answer.b: Stamens on the scale itself. Female catkins minute, sessile and budlike

answer.a: Flowers dioecious. Catkins cylindrical, compact and usually silky-hairy
answer.b: Flowers monoecious

answer.a: Male catkins slender and interrupted. Female flowers in small, sessile or shortly-stalked clusters
answer.b: Male catkins globular, on stalks hanging down. Females upright, globular, softly hairy

answer.a: Tree with broadly ovate, usually pointed leaves
answer.b: Shrub with small, orbicular leaves

answer.a: Hairless, warty shoots and more triangular pointed leaves with doubly serrate margins
answer.b: Shoots hairy and lacking warts, leaves more ovate and singly serrated

answer.a: Catkin scales entire. Stamens 2, rarely 3-5, with 1 or 2 gland-like inner scales
answer.b: Catkin scales toothed. Stamens several, in an slanting, cup-shaped perianth

answer.a: Under side of the leaves and young shoots very white and cottony
answer.b: Under side of the leaves green and glabrous

answer.a: Leaves ovate-triangular, tapering at the top, with small, regular teeth
answer.b: Leaves small, orbicular or rhomboidal, irregularly and rather coarsely toothed

answer.a: Male catkins sessile. Females sessile or on very short peduncles, with or without leafy bracts
answer.b: Male and female catkins on short, leafy shoots

answer.a: Stamen 1 within each scale, entire or forked. Leaves narrow, glabrous or whitish underneath. Anthers usually purple
answer.b: Stamens 2, distinct. Anthers usually yellow

answer.a: Leaves very silky and white, at least underneath
answer.b: Leaves glabrous, downy or cottony

answer.a: Stems erect, twiggy. Leaves long, lanceolate or linear
answer.b: Stems creeping underground. Leaves small, ovate, oblong or lanceolate

answer.a: Leaves wrinkled, usually with a short, crisp or cottony down, especially underneath. Capsules pedicellate
answer.b: Leaves not wrinkled

answer.a: Male catkins very silky, oblong. Capules 6-7 mm long. Leaves ovate or oblong
answer.b: Male catkins cylindrical, rather silky. Capsules 3-4 mm long. Leaves mostly obovate

answer.a: Leaves not wrinkled, glabrous and downy when young. Catkins rather slender. Capsules pedicellate
answer.b: Leaves not wrinkled, downy or wooly, quite entire. Catkins dense and very silky-hairy. Capsules sessile

answer.a: Catkins silky-white. Capsules 3-5 mm long
answer.b: Catkins golden-yellow. Capsules 4-6mm long

answer.a: Trees or tall shrubs
answer.b: Low, spreading or prostrate, or creeping shrubs

answer.a: Stamens about 5. Leaves dark-green and shining
answer.b: Other

answer.a: Stamens 3. Leaves green above, white underneath
answer.b: Stamens 2

answer.a: Leaves ashy-grey or silky-white. Capsules nearly sessile
answer.b: Leaves green or glabrous. Capsules pedicellate

answer.a: Catkins at the end of short, leafy shoots, without buds. Stems procumbent, ascending or forming low bushes
answer.b: Catkins on short peduncles, at the last leaf of a branch, with a bud in the angle, stems prostrate or creeping

answer.a: Leaves slightly toothed. Male catkins nearly sessile. Capsules pedicellate
answer.b: Leaves finely toothed. All the catkins on leafy stalks. Capsule almost sessile

answer.a: Leaves entire, wrinkled, white underneath
answer.b: Fruit not splitting, or splitting but remaining joined above.Leaves finely toothed, not wrinkled, green on both sides

answer.a: Scales of the catkin entire, leaves on short, stiff stalks
answer.b: Scales of the catkin toothed, leaves on long stalks, very broad

answer.a: Male catkins sessile. Females sessile or on very short peduncles, with or without leafy bracts
answer.b: Male and female catkins on short, leafy shoots

answer.b: Stamens 2, distinct. Anthers usually yellow

answer.a: Leaves very silky and white, at least underneath
answer.b: Leaves glabrous, downy or cottony

answer.a: Stems erect, twiggy. Leaves long, lanceolate or linear
answer.b: Stems creeping underground. Leaves small, ovate, oblong or lanceolate

answer.a: Leaves wrinkled, usually with a short, crisp or cottony down, especially underneath. Capsules pedicellate
answer.b: Leaves not wrinkled

answer.b: Male catkins cylindrical, rather silky. Capsules 3-4 mm long. Leaves mostly obovate

answer.b: Leaves not wrinkled, downy or wooly, quite entire. Catkins dense and very silky-hairy. Capsules sessile

answer.b: Catkins golden-yellow. Capsules 4-6mm long

answer.b: Other

answer.b: Leaves green or glabrous. Capsules pedicellate

answer.a: Catkins at the end of short, leafy shoots, without buds. Stems procumbent, ascending or forming low bushes

answer.a: Leaves slightly toothed. Male catkins nearly sessile. Capsules pedicellate
answer.b: Leaves finely toothed. All the catkins on leafy stalks. Capsule almost sessile

answer.b: Leaves entire or pinnate. Flowers in clusters

answer.a: Leaves edged by prickly coarse teeth
answer.b: Other

answer.a: Leaves heart shaped, fruit a small round nut -pea like- hanging from a ribbon like green yellow bract
answer.b: Stamens perigynous and numerous

answer.b: Flowers in pendulous racemes. Wings of the carpels erect, or slightly diverging

answer.b: Shrubs, with simple leaves, and a berry

answer.b: Flowers solitary or clustererd, from leafless buds

answer.b: Flowers in clusters, on pedicels longer then the flower itself

answer.b: Flowers in branched corymbs. Leaves often cut or divided

answer.b: Sepal-segments small. Flowers several together

answer.a: Flowers small and drooping. Leaves entire, white underneath
answer.b: Flowers showy, erect. Leaves toothed

answer.b: Styles distinct. Fruit pear-shaped

answer.b: Leaves green or loosely hairy underneath
